member.name: T:CircleDeveloperControlledWalletSDK.Services.EntitySecretService
member.summary: Service for managing entity secrets, including generation, encryption, and registration with Circle's API.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The HTTP client used for making API requests.
The cryptographic utilities for entity secret operations.
member.exception: Thrown when or is null.

member.name: M:CircleDeveloperControlledWalletSDK.Services.EntitySecretService.GenerateEntitySecret
member.summary: Generates a new entity secret using cryptographic utilities.
member.returns: A 32-byte hex string representing the generated entity secret.

member.name: M:CircleDeveloperControlledWalletSDK.Services.EntitySecretService.GenerateEntitySecretCiphertextAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Generates an encrypted ciphertext from the provided entity secret.
member.param: The entity secret to encrypt.
member.returns: A Task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result contains the encrypted ciphertext as a string.

member.name: M:CircleDeveloperControlledWalletSDK.Services.EntitySecretService.RegisterEntitySecretAsync(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Registers an entity secret with Circle's API and optionally saves recovery information to a file.
member.param: The entity secret to register, must be a 32-byte hex string.
Optional. The file path where recovery information will be saved.
member.returns: A Task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result contains the registration response from Circle's API.
member.exception: Thrown when entitySecret is null or empty.
Thrown when entitySecret is not a valid 32-byte hex string or when recoveryFilePath is invalid.
Thrown when there is an error writing to the recovery file.
Thrown when the API request fails.

member.summary: Lists all transactions with optional filters.
member.param: Filter by blockchain.
Filter by custody type.
Filter by destination address.
Include monitored and non-monitored tokens.
Filter by transaction operation.
Filter by transaction state.
Filter by transaction hash.
Filter by transaction type.
Comma-separated list of wallet IDs.
Filter transactions created since this date (inclusive).
Filter transactions created before this date (inclusive).
Pagination cursor for previous page.
Pagination cursor for next page.
Number of items per page (1-50).
Optional request identifier for Circle Support.

member.summary: Initiates an on-chain digital asset transfer from a developer-controlled wallet.
member.param: The wallet ID (required if sourceAddress and blockchain are not provided).
Unencrypted Entity Secret for ciphertext generation.
The destination blockchain address.
UUIDv4 idempotency key.
Transfer amounts (at least one required).
Fee level (LOW, MEDIUM, HIGH).
Gas limit (required if feeLevel is not provided).
Gas price in gwei (non-EIP-1559 chains).
Max fee in gwei (EIP-1559 chains).
Priority fee in gwei (EIP-1559 chains).
NFT token IDs for ERC-1155 batch transfers.
Optional reference ID for the transaction.
Token ID (mutually exclusive with tokenAddress and blockchain).
Token address (empty for native tokens).
Blockchain (required if tokenId is not provided).
Optional request identifier for Circle Support.
member.returns: A containing the transaction ID and state.
member.exception: Thrown when parameters are invalid.
Thrown when the API request fails.

ABI function parameters (mutually exclusive with callData).
Raw transaction data (hex, mutually exclusive with abiFunctionSignature).

Optional request identifier for Circle Support.

member.summary: Creates one or more developer-controlled wallets within a wallet set.

List of blockchains for the wallets.
Unencrypted Entity Secret for ciphertext generation.

Account type (EOA or SCA); defaults to EOA.
Number of wallets to create per blockchain; defaults to 1.
Metadata for each wallet; count must match if provided.
Optional request identifier for Circle Support.
member.returns: A containing the created wallets.
member.exception: Thrown when parameters are invalid.
Thrown when the API request fails.

member.summary: Signs a transaction from a specified developer-controlled wallet (supported chains only).
member.param: The wallet ID.
Unencrypted Entity Secret for ciphertext generation.
Raw transaction string (base64 for NEAR/Solana, hex for EVM).
JSON transaction object (EVM chains only).
Optional human-readable explanation for the sign action.
Optional request identifier for Circle Support.
member.returns: A containing the signature and signed transaction.
member.exception: Thrown when parameters are invalid.
Thrown when the API request fails.

member.name: M:CircleDeveloperControlledWalletSDK.Services.WalletService.SignDelegateActionAsync(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Signs a delegate action from a specified developer-controlled wallet (NEAR chains only).
member.param: The wallet ID.
Base64-encoded unsigned delegate action string.
Unencrypted Entity Secret for ciphertext generation.
Optional request identifier for Circle Support.
member.returns: A containing the signature and signed delegate action.
member.exception: Thrown when parameters are invalid.
Thrown when the API request fails.

member.name: T:CircleDeveloperControlledWalletSDK.Services.WalletSetService
member.summary: Service for managing wallet sets in the Circle API. Provides functionality to create, retrieve, and update wallet sets.

member.name: M:CircleDeveloperControlledWalletSDK.Services.WalletSetService.#ctor(System.Net.Http.HttpClient,CircleDeveloperControlledWalletSDK.Utilities.CryptoUtils)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The HTTP client used to make API requests.
member.exception: Thrown when is null.

member.name: M:CircleDeveloperControlledWalletSDK.Services.WalletSetService.CreateWalletSetAsync(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new developer-controlled wallet set.
member.param: Name or description of the wallet set.
Unencrypted Entity Secret (hex string).
Optional request ID for tracking with Circle Support.
member.returns: A containing the created wallet set details.
member.exception: Thrown when required parameters are null or empty.
Thrown when is invalid.
Thrown when the API request fails.
member.remarks: Requires a unique Entity Secret ciphertext, generated internally.

member.name: M:CircleDeveloperControlledWalletSDK.Services.WalletSetService.GetAllWalletSetsAsync(System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves all wallet sets asynchronously with optional filtering and pagination.
member.param: Optional start date for filtering wallet sets.
Optional end date for filtering wallet sets.
Optional token for retrieving the previous page of results.
Optional token for retrieving the next page of results.
Optional number of results per page (1-50).
Optional request ID for tracking the request.
member.returns: An array of objects representing the wallet sets.
member.exception: Thrown when invalid pagination parameters are provided.

member.name: M:CircleDeveloperControlledWalletSDK.Services.WalletSetService.GetWalletSetAsync(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves a specific wallet set by ID asynchronously.
member.param: The unique identifier of the wallet set to retrieve.
Optional request ID for tracking the request.
member.returns: A representing the asynchronous operation, containing the retrieved wallet set response.
member.exception: Thrown when is null or empty.
Thrown when the API request fails.

member.name: M:CircleDeveloperControlledWalletSDK.Services.WalletSetService.UpdateWalletSetAsync(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Updates an existing wallet set asynchronously.
member.param: The unique identifier of the wallet set to update.
The new name for the wallet set.
Optional request ID for tracking the request.
member.returns: A representing the asynchronous operation, containing the updated wallet set response.
member.exception: Thrown when id or name is null or empty.
Thrown when the API request fails.

member.name: T:CircleDeveloperControlledWalletSDK.Utilities.CryptoUtils
member.summary: Provides cryptographic utility functions for entity secret generation, encryption, and validation.

member.name: M:CircleDeveloperControlledWalletSDK.Utilities.CryptoUtils.#ctor(System.Net.Http.HttpClient)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The HTTP client used for making API requests.
member.exception: Thrown when is null.

member.name: M:CircleDeveloperControlledWalletSDK.Utilities.CryptoUtils.GenerateEntitySecret
member.summary: Generates a random 32-byte entity secret as a lowercase hexadecimal string.
member.returns: A 64-character lowercase hexadecimal string representing the entity secret.
member.exception: Thrown when entity secret generation fails.

member.name: M:CircleDeveloperControlledWalletSDK.Utilities.CryptoUtils.GenerateEntitySecretCiphertextAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Generates a Base64-encoded Entity Secret ciphertext using Circle's public key.
member.param: Unencrypted Entity Secret (64-character hex string).
member.returns: A Base64-encoded ciphertext (684 characters).
member.exception: Thrown when is null or empty.
Thrown when is not a valid 32-byte hex string.
Thrown when the public key retrieval fails.
Thrown when RSA encryption fails.
member.remarks: Fetches Circle's RSA public key from GET /v1/w3s/config/entity/publicKey and encrypts the Entity Secret using RSA with OAEP-SHA256 padding. The resulting ciphertext is unique per request, as required by Circle.

member.name: M:CircleDeveloperControlledWalletSDK.Utilities.CryptoUtils.IsHexString(System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether a string contains only valid hexadecimal characters (0-9, a-f, A-F).
member.param: The string to validate.
member.returns: true if the string contains only valid hexadecimal characters; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:CircleDeveloperControlledWalletSDK.Utilities.CryptoUtils.IsValidFilePath(System.String)
member.summary: Validates whether a given string represents a valid file path.
member.param: The file path to validate.
member.returns: true if the path is valid; otherwise, false.
